servinfo.title: Front Disc Brake Caliper Removal and Installation

item.ptxt: Do not allow brake fluid to get on painted surfaces. Painted surfaces will be damaged by brake fluid, flush it with water immediately if any fluid is spilled.
During removal, be careful not to damage brake flexible hose and not to depress brake pedal.
Do not reuse brake flexible hose washers. Otherwise, brake fluid may leak.

attention3.ptxt: When pads are removed, visually inspect caliper for brake fluid leak. Correct leaky point, if any.

s1.ptxt: Hoist vehicle and remove front wheel.
Remove brake flexible hose mounting bolt (1) from caliper (2). As this will allow fluid to flow out of hose (3), have a container ready beforehand.
Then tighten pin bolts to specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: Make sure that boots are fit into groove securely.

s1.ptxt: Install brake flexible hose and new hose washer as shown and tighten flexible hose joint bolt (1) to specified torque.
Fill reservoir with specified brake fluid and bleed brake system.
Tighten wheel nuts to specified torque.
After completing installation, check each installed part for oil leakage and perform brake test.
